for as soon as they are done quickly pull up their pants and hand them snack cup and they go right back to normal this is much better than having the kids suffering with the flu for week my son had perfectly healthy babies flu shots that what your doctor does why do you use this doctor left the hospital feeling like the worst mother on the planet and seriously doubting the decisions make as far as my son goes grew up with brother who had asthma for him getting the flu meant hospital visit at minimum it no brainer for me to get the flu shot for me and mine also there few older folks with complications on my road if gave it to them well their house would be on the market come spring my youngest got the flu at 6mo old days after her 6mo shots where opted not to get her the flu shot she was lethargic and just really sick we were lucky it was early enough in the flu season to get tamiflu amd even then it was touch and go for few days on whether to take her to the hospital before that wasnt proponent am now both my girls have them this year and ll be getting it as well no reason not to and dont want to go through the stress again nor do want my child that sick do see any reason not bother getting the shot if she just going to get it anyways what if the shot gives her the flu too did some research and just could find anything with medical sound advice saying that you should get infant or elderly grandmother get the flu it is potentially life threatening sickness getting the flu shot too because still breastfeeding and do feel like breastfeeding while sick it would seriously your baby would be getting shot anyways do listen to her it preventative not cure once you already have it think you are doing the right thing getting the flu shot the earlier the better my dad planned on getting the flu shot but he got the flu in august it was too late if you doubt your doctor maybe tell him what the nurse said so he can explain and then get second opinion so you can make
